sentences.en: ‘Did you go into the supermarket?’ ‘No, we didn’t.’
sentences.cn: “你们进超级市场了吗？”“我们没有进去。”

sentences.en: By golly we can do something about it this time.
sentences.cn: 这次我们确实可以采取行动了。

sentences.en: Don't worry. We'll have you out of here double-quick.
sentences.cn: 别担心，我们会很快把你从这儿弄出去的。

sentences.en: For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbours, and laugh at them in our turn?
sentences.cn: 我们活着是为了什么？不就是给邻居当笑柄，再反过来笑他们。

sentences.en: He told us to get stuffed so we leaned on his kid.
sentences.cn: 他叫我们滚蛋，于是我们威胁他的孩子。

sentences.en: It's an uphill battle but I think we're going to win.
sentences.cn: 虽然这是一场艰苦的斗争，但我相信我们会取得胜利。

sentences.en: Shall we stop for a coffee?
sentences.cn: 我们停下来喝杯咖啡好吗？

sentences.en: So we all travelled down to Brighton together.
sentences.cn: 所以我们一起都去了布赖顿。

sentences.en: So, if we could just move onto something else?
sentences.cn: 那么我们可不可以干脆谈点别的？

sentences.en: We all know that fats spoil by becoming rancid.
sentences.cn: 我们都知道油脂变质后会发臭。

sentences.en: We are becoming one of the market leaders in the fashion industry.
sentences.cn: 我们正在成为时装业的领军者之一。

sentences.en: We are taught to construe these terms in a particular way.
sentences.cn: 我们被教导要以特定的方式理解这些词语。

sentences.en: We declare our support for a government of national unity.
sentences.cn: 我们宣布支持一个全国统一的政府。

sentences.en: We have a very communicative approach to teaching languages.
sentences.cn: 我们在语言教学中非常强调交际教学法。

sentences.en: We have the interest of 500,000 customers to think of.
sentences.cn: 我们得为50万名顾客的利益着想。

sentences.en: We Italians are proud of our history.
sentences.cn: 我们意大利人为自己的历史感到自豪。

sentences.en: We post up a set of rules for the house.
sentences.cn: 我们张贴了一份房屋生活守则。

sentences.en: We tend to meet up for lunch once a week.
sentences.cn: 我们往往每周共进一次午餐。

sentences.en: We'll go to a meeting in Birmingham and come straight back.
sentences.cn: 我们将去伯明翰参加会议，然后马上回来。

sentences.en: You flatter yourself. Why would we go to such ludicrous lengths?
sentences.cn: 你真自以为是。我们为什么要费那么大的力气？

trans.tran_en: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people
